The Food Security Bill: Is it a boon or bane for Indian Economy? Do you think the Bill can help protect people against poverty and insecurity?

As a living being on earth we are entitled to consume food for our life. Mother nature has provided variety of sources through which we can fulfil our basic need of food.

Earlier the humans were free to utilize the edible things according to their choice , but as the revolution introduced in our society , we started being dependent on higher authority. Previously King was responsible to manage this kind of duties for society welfare.

Later on , basically after independence the concept of "Government" was introduced. Till now this trend is going on . Now a days we are completely dependent on policies given by Govt. . Every aspect of our life is directly or indirectly is influenced by the Govt.

Budgets, bills, tax , import , export etc. , so many things are there which are directly controlled by the Govt..

So the power of whole nation is in the hand of Govt. of India . Like two sides of a coin , there are  some pros and cons of this power. In India the main cons is the politics of votes. Our maximum politicians are only concerned with their positions only . We can see so many advertisement on T.V at the time of elections, which shows many promises made by politicians ,but in real they are just a rosy picture.

'Food Security Bill' is one of them. In our country the ratio of rich and poor population is imbalanced.
There is a big gap between the two , and within this gap middle class is present. Thus we have huge amount of poor and middle class people , so it is clearly visible that they are the big vote bank for politicians.
The high class people are hardly concerned about the price hikes of commodities , as they have enough money to spend .

On the other side the poor and middle class are very much influenced by this price variation , as there  amount for spending is very limited , even sometime they survive by having one time meal.

By announcing this type of Bills the Govt.  wants to attract the attention of people towards them.
Reality is entirely different. There are so many mandatory formalities ,which you are supposed to complete to utilize this facility. In fact , still there are so many people who are struggling for 'Rashan Card'. One reality show on T.V , has broadcast one story of the sexual harassment of girl by one politician ,who wanted to get Rashan Card for her family living.

So now , how can we say that we should  feel secure by having such kind of bills. There are so many traders who make money by using these facilities of Govt . ,because we are not directly connected with Govt., a long channel is exist between us, and this channel is filled with corrupt people. 

Although the 'Right of Information Act' is present in our constitution , but most of the poor people are illiterate, who are hardly aware about their rights. Govt. feels that that people are utilizing the advantage of bills passed by them.

So I think that there is no way to protect people form poverty and insecurity, by defining bills. Our Govt. have to follow the strict guidelines, they have create proper channels and develop certain departments who will be responsible to conduct the security of people and will work for prevention of poverty. They will report directly to the Govt. about their work . 

If our Govt. develop such environment, we will be able to live like earlier with no dependency of such bills.
